abstract.text: A session object used to create and update messages.

inlineContent.text: class does not declare any instance methods or properties. iMessage apps use
objects to identify and track updatable messages.
objects associated with a session receive the following treatment in the transcript:
The first time a session is used, the message appears normally in the transcript.
If a later message is sent using the same session, the previous message is removed from the transcript. The new message, with the updated content, is added to the bottom of the transcript, as normal.
If the previous message has a non-
property, the Messages app creates a summary message from the text and inserts it in the message’s previous location.
Use the following workflow to create a new, updatable message.
A new URL that encodes the message’s initial state. For example, you could encode data as key-value pairs in the URL’s query string. For more information, see the
A new layout object that describes the initial message’s appearance. For more information, see the
A string that describes the message’s current state. For more information, see the
method and passing the session object. Set the message’s
Send the message by calling the conversation’s
The Messages app adds the message to the transcript as soon as the user taps the send button.
Use the following workflow to receive and update a message.
When the user taps on one of your
property is changed to the tapped message. Use key-value observing to respond to these changes. Extract the current state from the message’s
property, and present it to the user.
For more information on receiving messages, see
After the user responds, create the following:
A new URL that encodes the updated message state. For example, you could encode the data as key-value pairs in the URL’s query string. For more information, see the
A new layout object that describes the updated message’s appearance. For more information, see the
A string that describes the message’s current state. For more information, see the
method and passing the currently selected message’s
Send the updated message by calling the conversation’s
The Messages app updates the message in the transcript as soon as the user taps the send button.

abstract.text: Implemented by subclasses to initialize a new object (the receiver) immediately after memory for it has been allocated.
Create app extensions that allow users to send text, stickers, media files, and interactive messages.
Inserts a message object into the Messages app’s input field.
The message that the user selected in the conversation transcript.
A custom message object.
Initializes a new message that is part of the provided session.
A layout object that defines the message’s appearance.
A succinct description of the message.
A URL that encodes data to be transmitted with the message.
An abstract base class that defines the appearance of
objects in the conversation transcript.
A layout that provides a custom, interactive view inside the transcript.
A template-based layout for custom messages.
A session object used to create and update messages.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
